lines.text: I didn't actually see anything in his flat, sir, but he could have gone in and taken the little girl's things any time this morning.
Why should he, I wonder.
Bloody pervert, if you want my opinion, sir. Kept on asking Rogers to strike him.
Please, Andrews, he works for the BBC.
I never lie, Superintendent.
And that makes you a most unusual woman, Ms. Ford.
Bus drivers are rarely observant. They tend to be dreamers, philosophers, that sort of thing. Self protection I suppose.
Ever heard him read poetry? It's like a Welsh parson gargling with molasses.
This doll had almost been loved to death. You know, love inflicts the most terrible injuries on my small patients.
[last lines]
Sleep well. Both of you. Now that you exist.
Junket is junket. No matter what you do with it, it still tastes like swill and swallows like slime.
I have some more African heads in my apartment. Small, pickled ones. Do drop in anytime you care to meet some unsuccessful politicians.
I must now, I suppose, enter the personality of a 4-year old female child possessed of a strong conviction that all forbidden doors are to be opened.
There are those at the BBC who bear like medals the bruises left by the love of Horatio Wilson.

[holding a damaged doll that he is trying to repair]
I've got a near fatality here.
If we hadn't been away we'd have organised a small but vociferous reception committee.
[first lines]
She may be a few minutes late. Will you please wait for her?
Yes sir.
Thank you.
